title: Create a simple User Details form with required-field validation (React + TypeScript)

requirements.text: Create a new frontend page/screen that contains a simple "User Details" form implemented in React + TypeScript, with common user fields (at minimum: First name, Last name, Email) and a primary submit button.

quotes: I need to start with simple User detail form which take input and also validation of required etc in that form with react.

acceptanceCriteria: A User Details form is reachable in the app UI (e.g., routed page or main screen).
Form renders at least these labeled inputs: First name, Last name, Email, plus a Submit button.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement required-field validation for the User Details form, including inline error messages and blocking submission until all required fields are valid.

quotes: ...take input and also validation of required etc in that form with react.

acceptanceCriteria: Submitting with any required field empty shows an inline validation message near the field.
Email field validates basic email format and shows an inline validation message when invalid.
Submit action is prevented while validation errors exist.
When the form is valid and submitted, the UI shows a clear success state (e.g., success message) and logs/prints the collected values for now (no backend persistence required).

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the form screen (typography, spacing, button and input styles) using Tailwind and existing UI components, ensuring consistent layout and accessibility (labels, focus states, and error styling).
acceptanceCriteria: Form uses consistent spacing, readable typography, and clear hierarchy.
Inputs have visible focus styles; error states are visually distinct (e.g., border + message).
All inputs have associated labels; validation messages are readable and placed consistently.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing components instead).
Do not edit files listed as immutable: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
No backend changes are required for this initial form; keep this as a frontend-only foundation.
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication or user login.
Persisting user details to the Motoko backend.
Full CRUD (create/list/edit/delete) flows beyond the single form.
